column2:
ADJECTIVE

1Occurring or done in brief, irregular bursts.
‘___ fighting continued’  
2Caused by, subject to, or in the nature of a _*_ or _*_s.
‘a ___ cough’

VERB

[WITH OBJECT]
Make (someone) feel intimidated or apprehensive.
‘some people are __d by technology’

NOUN

1A drink poured out as an offering to a deity.
‘he poured the ___ of rum on the ground’  
1.1mass noun The pouring out of a ___.
‘gin was poured in ___’

NOUN

A chiefly American herbaceous plant which bears heads of bright showy flowers, widely cultivated as a garden ornamental.

NOUN

A back or side entrance.
as modifier ‘a small ___ door’

VERB

[WITH OBJECT]
Drink (something, especially an alcoholic drink) heartily.
‘he __d pint after pint of good Berkshire ale’

The quality of having strong moral principles; honesty and decency.

in singular
1A source of help in a difficult situation.
‘surgery may be the only ___’

ADJECTIVE
